reviews.review_msg: Enjoyed 201 with him and found his instruction very clear. This past term 347 was potentially my least favourite class yet. His lectures and the material was so dry and with no exams, it was difficult to stay engaged. Papers were based solely off readings/research, while lectures were kind of pointless. Pop quizzes were the only reason to attend.

Avoid this prof like the plague. The class should be called "war", cause he only discusses conflict in war contexts (Vietnam war, cold war, etc.). The readings do not correlate at all to the lectures, and the lectures are incredibly disorganized. The whole class is disorganized, for that matter. I to re-write a group presentation three times cause he didn't leave enough time in class. He'll also hold you to a higher standard if he thinks you're smart, while others get an "A for effort" deal.
His TAs sucks.  He is nice teacher but make sure to get in his tutorial.

He was not my kind of teacher. I felt he was under prepared for classes, but instead would just take bits of information on any given subject from his expansive knowledge. It shows that while he knows a lot, he is not interested in passing the information to students, merely just showing the information.
Great prof. Very friendly and an interesting speaker with lots of passion for his ideas. Highly recommended!
If you need a concrete guideline for assignments to get them done, this class isn't for you. He's vague about EVERYTHING, including his expectations. Easy marker though, and cares for his students.
does not undermine, encourages, best prof currently at sfu

Terry brings his real life day job as a mediator to the class room which gives the material a lot more depth. Do the work, participate, go to class, follow the criteria, and think outside the box and you'll get a good mark. He's also always willing to help in office hours if you need it. Great prof! Take a class with him if you can!

He's very helpful. He can be reached easily when you need a help. He even left us his phone number. However, I feel like his lectures were flat and boring. His expectations for assignments were unclear as well.
Cares about his students. Final exam is easy. Lectures can feel a little long, but are pretty interesting.

There is little structure or coherence to this course. The concepts are confusing and amorphous. It would help if Terry would draw clear and strong links between the concepts and the conflicts he presents. The mid-term (worth 40%) is actually 10% test and 30% proposal for the final paper. Mid-term was "open computer" - not fair to students without

Passionate BUT provided minimal feedback on project proposals and then ripped the project apart at the end. Seems very set on his ways... very hard marker. Intelligent and interesting BUT an incredibly hard marker.
